result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory L Turner Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

2:38 PM Defendant Gregory L Turner Jr in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gregory L Turner Jr
Current: 2515 N. Palmer St., Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: 1130 N 29th St #107, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney office.
10/29 bail money posted at MCSO; warrant will be cancelled upon receipt of funds.

11:20 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Gregory L Turner Jr not in court. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $500.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 3.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
